WRITING.TEXT: Yes - but what's worse is the amount of dog fouling in parts of Edinburgh. Granted, it's a minority of dog owners, but I just can't get my head round the mentality of someone who thinks that's ok.
When I said 'both' I meant Princes St and George St. I do realise they're already banned from Princes St. It was a lazy way to put it, from me, admittedly!

WRITING.TITLE: New director of BBC Scotland: There are deficits in our coverage

WRITING.TEXT: Cars could still use Queens St and the Old Town. Radical perhaps, but why should anyone apart from a very few people (disabled, elderly etc) really need to drive their car through the centre of town? Other European cities are much further ahead than us in making their centres greener, more pleasant areas where people can actually walk and enjoy the urban space.
Make Queens St the bus route. Ban cars from both.
